learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate the intersection of food science with nutrition science to justify your approach to the translation of nutrition science into dietetic practice
Recognise complexity and apply critical reasoning when analysing the impact of national and global Agri-food system at multiple levels of the food supply
Apply extensive understanding of nutrition and food sciences, and food sustainability to evaluate and justify practical information and recommendations for consumers
Explain and justify the role of traditional dietary patterns in a food system compared with ultra-processed foods

Work effectively within a student team to develop communication and process management skills by collaboratively modifying recipes for clients with varied medical/dietary conditions and integrating AI tools to solve nutrition and food science problems

assessments.task_description:
Students conduct hands-on dietary modifications in kitchen laboratory sessions, adapting recipes for specific dietary needs or health conditions. The assessment requires detailed documentation of ingredient substitutions, cooking methods, and their impact on nutritional content, taste, and texture. Students analyze the food science principles underlying their modifications and provide practical recommendations for clients, including preparation ease and cost considerations. The report includes comprehensive sections on aims, methods, results, analysis, and conclusions, with emphasis on translating nutrition science into practical dietary advice. This assessment develops critical skills in recipe modification, client-centred nutrition counselling, and understanding the intersection of food science with therapeutic nutrition practice. The Dietary Modification report outcomes will include comments on information that can be provided to clients about preparing modified recipes as well as links to planetary health.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In-class quiz on various topics studied throughout the semester.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This online module prepares students for the AI-Powered Food System Analysis Project by developing essential skills in using AI tools professionally and responsibly. Students will learn to leverage Microsoft Copilot effectively while maintaining critical thinking and evidence-based practice standards essential for dietetics professionals. The module involves three progressive online activities that build students' AI skills. Each activity includes guided practice, reflection, and documentation requirements. This module is designed to be completed at students' own pace over 4 weeks.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Evidence of completion of module to be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: AI Powered Food Systems Analysis Project
assessments.task_description:
Modern dietetic practice increasingly involves working within complex food systems where AI tools are becoming standard for product development, nutritional analysis, and consumer communication. This project develops your ability to leverage AI effectively while maintaining the critical thinking and evidence-based approach essential for professional practice. You will conduct a comprehensive analysis that simulates real-world scenarios where dietitians collaborate with food industry professionals to improve public health outcomes through product reformulation.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Session 1: Dietary modification 1

Food law, nutrigenomics, and other critical thinking around aspects of nutrition science
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 1: Dietary modification 1 Food law, nutrigenomics, and other critical thinking around aspects of nutrition science

learning_activities.topic:
Session 2: Dietary modification 2

Observing nutritional analysis in the laboratory (including proximates, micronutrients, total phenolic content, fibre); Creating and tasting special dietary foods, and novel foods; Creating and examining foods with different textures and assessing impact on nutritional content; Observation of "cutting edge" analysis techniques
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 2: Dietary modification 2 Observing nutritional analysis in the laboratory (including proximates, micronutrients, total phenolic content, fibre); Creating and tasting special dietary foods, and novel foods; Creating and examining foods with different textures and assessing impact on nutritional content; Observation of "cutting edge" analysis techniques

learning_activities.topic:
Session 3: Consumer Science and Dietary Patterns

You will watch a video of a laboratory analysis of moisture content and write a lab report using the scientific method to submit for assessment
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 3: Consumer Science and Dietary Patterns You will watch a video of a laboratory analysis of moisture content and write a lab report using the scientific method to submit for assessment

learning_activities.topic:
Session 4: Food Systems

You will participate in a "mystery box" challenge in the kitchen, creating a range of high protein/high energy meals and snacks
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 4: Food Systems You will participate in a "mystery box" challenge in the kitchen, creating a range of high protein/high energy meals and snacks

learning_activities.topic:
Session 5: In-class quiz and finale

We will be learning about the Australian food system and how it interacts locally and globally. We will also be examining the recent CSIRO Food Systems Roadmap.
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 5: In-class quiz and finale We will be learning about the Australian food system and how it interacts locally and globally. We will also be examining the recent CSIRO Food Systems Roadmap.
